1: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
    2: %%% File     : Emysql/test/basics_SUITE.erl
    3: %%% Descr    : Suite #2: Tests of basic SQL statements,
    4: %%%            prepared statements, stored procedures
    5: %%% Author   : H. Diedrich
    6: %%% Created  : 12/13/2011 hd
    7: %%% Requires : Erlang 14B (prior may not have ct_run)
    8: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
    9: %%%
   10: %%% Run from Emysql/:
   11: %%%     make test
   12: %%%
   13: %%% Results see:
   14: %%%     test/index.html
   15: %%%
   16: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   17: 
   18: -module(basics_SUITE).
   19: -compile(export_all).
   20: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   21: -include("../include/emysql.hrl").
   22: 
   23: -record(hello_record, {hello_text}).
   24: 
   25: %% Optional suite settings
   26: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   27: %% Function: suite() -> Info
   28: %% Info = [tuple()]
   29: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   33: 
   34: %% Mandatory list of test cases and test groups, and skip orders.
   35: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   36: %% Function: all() -> GroupsAndTestCases | {skip,Reason}
   37: %% GroupsAndTestCases = [{group,GroupName} | TestCase]
   38: %% GroupName = atom()
   39: %% TestCase = atom()
   40: %% Reason = term()
   41: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   42: 
   43: all() ->
   44:     [delete_all,
   45:      encode_atoms,
   46:      insert_only,
   47:      insert_a_record,
   48:      select_a_record,
   49: 
   50:      insert_and_read_back,
   51:      insert_and_read_back_as_recs,
   52:      insert_and_read_back_as_json,
   53:      select_by_prepared_statement,
   54: 	 delete_non_existant_procedure,
   55: 	 select_by_stored_procedure,
   56:      multiple_select,
   57:      encode_floating_point_data,
   58:      emit_warnings,
   59:      {group, conversion}].
   60: 
   61: groups() ->
   62:     [{conversion, [parallel],
   63:         [dict_empty_test,
   64:          dict_single_test,
   65:          dict_multi_test,
   66:          proplist_empty_test,
   67:          proplist_single_test,
   68:          proplist_multi_test,
   69:          json_empty_test,
   70:          json_single_test,
   71:          json_multi_test,
   72:          record_test]}
   73:     ].
   74: 
   75: %% Optional suite pre test initialization
   76: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   77: %% Function: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   78: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
   79: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
   80: %% Reason = term()
   81: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   82: 
   83: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   84: 
   85: 	% if this fails, focus on environment_SUITE to fix test setup.
   86:     crypto:start(),
   87:     application:start(emysql),
   88:     emysql:add_pool(test_pool, [
   89:         {size, 1},
   90:         {user, test_helper:test_u()},
   91:         {password, test_helper:test_p()},
   92:         {host, "localhost"},
   93:         {port, 3306},
   94:         {database, "hello_database"},
   95:         {encoding, utf8},
   96:         {warnings, true}]),
   97: 
   98:     Config.
   99: 
  100: %% Optional suite post test wind down
  101: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  102: %% Function: end_per_suite(Config0) -> void() | {save_config,Config1}
  103: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  104: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  105: 
  106: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  107: 	emysql:remove_pool(test_pool),
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: %% A test case. The ok is irrelevant. What matters is, if it returns.
  111: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  112: %% Function: TestCase(Config0) ->
  113: %%               ok | exit() | {skip,Reason} | {comment,Comment} |
  114: %%               {save_config,Config1} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
  115: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  116: %% Reason = term()
  117: %% Comment = term()
  118: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  119: 
  120: %% Test Case: Delete all records in the test database
  121: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  122: delete_all(_) ->
  123: 
  124:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  125:     ok.
  126: 
  127: 
  128: %% Test Case: Make an Insert
  129: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  130: insert_only(_) ->
  131: 
  132:     emysql:execute(test_pool,
  133:         <<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  134: 
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: %TODO: Probably don't need to keep botht his and insert_only
  138: % Test Case: Test if we can insert a record.
  139: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  140: insert_a_record(_) ->
  141:     #ok_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  142:     #ok_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool,
  143:         <<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>).
  144: 
  145: % Test Case: Test if we can select records.
  146: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  147: select_a_record(_) ->
  148:     #result_packet{rows=[[<<"Hello World!">>]]} =
  149:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"select hello_text from hello_table">>).
  150: 
  151: 
  152: %% Test Case: Allow insertion of atom values through the encoder
  153: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  154: encode_atoms(_Config) ->
  155:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DROP TABLE encode_atoms_test">>),
  156:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"CREATE TABLE encode_atoms_test (x VARCHAR(32))">>),
  157: 
  158:     emysql:prepare(encode_atoms, <<"INSERT INTO encode_atoms_test (x) VALUES (?)">>),
  159:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, encode_atoms, [foo]),
  160:     ct:log("Result: ~p", [Result]),
  161: 
  162:     ok_packet = element(1, Result),
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: %% Test Case: Make an Insert and Select it back
  166: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  167: insert_and_read_back(_) ->
  168: 
  169:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  170: 
  171:     emysql:execute(test_pool,
  172:         <<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  173: 
  174:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool,
  175:         <<"select hello_text from hello_table">>),
  176: 
  177: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  178: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Result]),
  179: 
  180: 	% the test
  181: 	{result_packet,5,
  182:                [#field{seq_num=2,
  183:                        catalog= <<"def">>,
  184:                        db= <<"hello_database">>,
  185:                        table= <<"hello_table">>,
  186:                        org_table= <<"hello_table">>,
  187:                        name= <<"hello_text">>,
  188:                        org_name= <<"hello_text">>,
  189:                        type=254,
  190:                        default= <<>>,
  191:                        charset_nr=33,
  192:                        length=_,
  193:                        flags=_,
  194:                        decimals=0,
  195:                        decoder = _ }],
  196:                [[<<"Hello World!">>]],
  197:                <<>>} = Result,
  198: 
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: %% Test Case: Encode floating point data into a test table (Issue 57)
  202: encode_floating_point_data(_Config) ->
  203:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DROP TABLE float_test">>),
  204:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"CREATE TABLE float_test ( x FLOAT )">>),
  205:     emysql:prepare(encode_float_stmt, <<"INSERT INTO float_test (x) VALUES (?)">>),
  206: 
  207:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, encode_float_stmt, [3.14]),
  208: 
  209:     ct:log("Result: ~p", [Result]),
  210:     ok_packet = element(1, Result),
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: emit_warnings(_Config) ->
  214:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS not_a_table">>),
  215:     %% Test: there should be exactly 1 warning.
  216:     #ok_packet{warning_count = 1} = Result,
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: %% Test Case: Make an Insert and Select it back, reading out as Record
  220: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  221: insert_and_read_back_as_recs(_) ->
  222: 
  223:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  224: 
  225: 	emysql:execute(test_pool,
  226: 		<<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  227: 
  228: 	Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"SELECT * from hello_table">>),
  229: 
  230: 	Recs = emysql_util:as_record(
  231: 		Result, hello_record, record_info(fields, hello_record)),
  232: 
  233: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  234: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Recs]),
  235: 
  236: 	% the test
  237: 	Recs = [{hello_record,<<"Hello World!">>}],
  238: 
  239: 	ok.
  240: 
  241: %% Test Case: Make an Insert and Select it back, reading out as JSON
  242: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  243: insert_and_read_back_as_json(_) ->
  244: 
  245:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  246: 
  247:     emysql:execute(test_pool,
  248:         <<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  249: 
  250:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"SELECT * from hello_table">>),
  251: 
  252:     Recs = emysql_util:as_json(Result),
  253: 
  254:     % find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  255:     io:format("~p~n", [Recs]),
  256: 
  257:     % the test
  258:     Recs = [[{<<"hello_text">>,<<"Hello World!">>}]],
  259: 
  260:     ok.
  261: 
  262: %% Test Case: Create a Prepared Statement and make a Select with it
  263: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  264: select_by_prepared_statement(_) ->
  265: 
  266:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  267: 
  268: 	emysql:execute(test_pool,
  269: 		<<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  270: 
  271: 	emysql:prepare(test_stmt,
  272: 		<<"SELECT * from hello_table WHERE hello_text like ?">>),
  273: 
  274: 	Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, test_stmt, ["Hello%"]),
  275: 
  276: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  277: 	ct:log("Result: ~p~n", [Result]),
  278: 
  279: 	% the test
  280: 	{result_packet,5,
  281:                     [#field{
  282:                             seq_num=2,
  283:                             catalog= <<"def">>,
  284:                             db= <<"hello_database">>,
  285:                             table= <<"hello_table">>,
  286:                             org_table= <<"hello_table">>,
  287:                             name= <<"hello_text">>,
  288:                             org_name= <<"hello_text">>,
  289:                             type=254,
  290:                             default = <<>>,
  291:                             charset_nr = 33,
  292:                             length= _Length,
  293:                             flags = _Flags,
  294:                             decimals = 0,
  295:                             decoder = _Decoder}],
  296:                        [[<<"Hello World!">>]],
  297:                        <<>>} = Result,
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: multiple_select(_) ->
  301:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  302: 
  303: 	emysql:execute(test_pool,
  304: 		<<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  305: 
  306: 	[Result1, Result2] = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"SELECT * from hello_table; SELECT * from hello_table">>),
  307: 
  308: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  309: 	ct:log("Result1: ~p~n", [Result1]),
  310: 	ct:log("Result2: ~p~n", [Result2]),
  311: 
  312: 	% the test
  313: 	{result_packet,5,
  314:                     [#field{
  315:                             seq_num=_,
  316:                             catalog= <<"def">>,
  317:                             db= <<"hello_database">>,
  318:                             table= <<"hello_table">>,
  319:                             org_table= <<"hello_table">>,
  320:                             name= <<"hello_text">>,
  321:                             org_name= <<"hello_text">>,
  322:                             type=254,
  323:                             default = <<>>,
  324:                             charset_nr = 33,
  325:                             length= _Length,
  326:                             flags = _Flags,
  327:                             decimals = 0,
  328:                             decoder = _Decoder}],
  329:                        [[<<"Hello World!">>]],
  330:                        <<>>} = Result1,
  331: 	{result_packet,_,
  332:                     [#field{
  333:                             seq_num=_,
  334:                             catalog= <<"def">>,
  335:                             db= <<"hello_database">>,
  336:                             table= <<"hello_table">>,
  337:                             org_table= <<"hello_table">>,
  338:                             name= <<"hello_text">>,
  339:                             org_name= <<"hello_text">>,
  340:                             type=254,
  341:                             default = <<>>,
  342:                             charset_nr = 33,
  343:                             length= _Length,
  344:                             flags = _Flags,
  345:                             decimals = 0,
  346:                             decoder = _Decoder}],
  347:                        [[<<"Hello World!">>]],
  348:                        <<>>} = Result2,
  349:     ok.
  350: 
  351: %% Test Case: Delete a non-existant Stored Procedure
  352: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  353: delete_non_existant_procedure(_) ->
  354: 
  355: 	Result1 = emysql:execute(test_pool,
  356: 	  	<<"drop procedure sp_me_no_exist">>),
  357: 	  	% note: returns ok even if sp_hello does not exist
  358: 
  359: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  360: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Result1]),
  361: 
  362: 	% test
  363: 	Result1 = {error_packet,1,1305,<<"42000">>,
  364:               "PROCEDURE hello_database.sp_me_no_exist does not exist"},
  365: 
  366: 	ok.
  367: 
  368: %% Test Case: Create a Stored Procedure and make a Select with it
  369: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  370: select_by_stored_procedure(_) ->
  371: 
  372:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DELETE FROM hello_table">>),
  373: 
  374: 	emysql:execute(test_pool,
  375: 		<<"INSERT INTO hello_table SET hello_text = 'Hello World!'">>),
  376: 
  377: 	Result1 = emysql:execute(test_pool,
  378: 	  	<<"drop procedure sp_hello">>),
  379: 	  	% note: returns ok even if sp_hello does not exist
  380: 
  381: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  382: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Result1]),
  383: 
  384: 	% first test
  385: 	case Result1 of
  386: 		{ok_packet,1,0,0,_,0,[]} -> ok;
  387: 		{error_packet,1,1305,<<"42000">>,
  388:               "PROCEDURE hello_database.sp_hello does not exist"} -> ok
  389:     end,
  390: 
  391: 	Result2 = emysql:execute(test_pool,
  392: 	  	<<"create procedure sp_hello() begin select * from hello_table limit 2; end">>),
  393: 
  394: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  395: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Result2]),
  396: 
  397: 	% second test
  398: 	{ok_packet,1,0,0,_,0,[]} = Result2,
  399: 
  400: 	Result3 = emysql:execute(test_pool,	<<"call sp_hello();">>),
  401: 
  402: 	% find this output by clicking on the test name, then case name in test/index.html
  403: 	ct:log("~p~n", [Result3]),
  404: 
  405: 	% third, main test
  406: 	[{result_packet,5, _Fields, [[<<"Hello World!">>]], <<>>}, {ok_packet,6,0,0,_,0,[]}] = Result3,
  407: 
  408: 	ok.
  409: 
  410: %%% Conversion routine tests
  411: %% --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  412: 
  413: dict_empty_test(_) ->
  414:     E = dict:from_list([]),
  415:     E = emysql_util:as_dict(get_empty_test()),
  416:     E = emysql:as_dict(get_empty_test()),
  417:     ok.
  418: 
  419: dict_single_test(_) ->
  420:     E = dict:from_list([{<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>}]),
  421:     E = emysql_util:as_dict(get_single_test()),
  422:     E = emysql:as_dict(get_single_test()),
  423:     ok.
  424: 
  425: dict_multi_test(_) ->
  426:     E = dict:from_list([
  427:             {<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>},
  428:             {<<"HiField">>,<<"Hi">>},
  429:             {<<"ByeField">>,<<"Bye">>}
  430:     ]),
  431:     E = emysql_util:as_dict(get_multi_test()),
  432:     E = emysql:as_dict(get_multi_test()),
  433:     ok.
  434: 
  435: proplist_empty_test(_) ->
  436:     [] = emysql_util:as_proplist(get_empty_test()),
  437:     [] = emysql:as_proplist(get_empty_test()),
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: proplist_single_test(_) ->
  441:     Expect = [ [{<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>}] ],
  442:     Expect = emysql_util:as_proplist(get_single_test()),
  443:     Expect = emysql:as_proplist(get_single_test()),
  444:     ok.
  445: 
  446: proplist_multi_test(_) ->
  447:     Expect = [ [{<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>},{<<"HiField">>,<<"Hi">>},{<<"ByeField">>,<<"Bye">>}] ],
  448:     Expect = emysql_util:as_proplist(get_multi_test()),
  449:     Expect = emysql:as_proplist(get_multi_test()),
  450:     ok.
  451: 
  452: json_empty_test(_) ->
  453:     [] = emysql_util:as_json(get_empty_test()),
  454:     [] = emysql:as_json(get_empty_test()),
  455:     ok.
  456: 
  457: json_single_test(_) ->
  458:     Expect = [ [{<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>}] ],
  459:     Expect = emysql_util:as_json(get_single_test()),
  460:     Expect = emysql:as_json(get_single_test()),
  461:     ok.
  462: 
  463: json_multi_test(_) ->
  464:     Expect = [ [{<<"HelloField">>,<<"Hello">>},{<<"HiField">>,<<"Hi">>},{<<"ByeField">>,<<"Bye">>}] ],
  465:     Expect = emysql_util:as_json(get_multi_test()),
  466:     Expect = emysql:as_json(get_multi_test()),
  467:     ok.
  468: 
  469: -record(person, {surname, name, phone, socks}).
  470: record_test(_Config) ->
  471:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS as_record_test;">>),
  472:     emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"CREATE TABLE as_record_test (name varchar(60), surname varchar(60), socks int)">>),
  473: 
  474:     emysql:prepare(ins, <<"INSERT INTO as_record_test (name, surname, socks) VALUES (?, ?, ?)">>),
  475:     emysql:execute(test_pool, ins, [<<"Maxim">>, <<"Komar">>, 3]),
  476: 
  477:                         % test
  478:     Result = emysql:execute(test_pool, <<"select * from as_record_test">>),
  479:     Expected = [#person{ surname = <<"Komar">>, name = <<"Maxim">>, socks=3 }],
  480:     Expected = emysql_util:as_record(Result, person, record_info(fields, person)),
  481:     Expected = emysql:as_record(Result, person, record_info(fields, person)),
  482:     ok.
  483: 
  484: 
  485: %%% Data generation
  486: %% --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  487: fields() ->
  488:     [{field,2,<<"def">>,<<"hello_database">>,<<"hello_table">>,
  489:                         <<"hello_table">>,<<"hello_text">>,<<"hello_text">>,
  490:                         254,<<>>,33,60,0,0}].
  491: 
  492: get_empty_test() ->
  493:     #result_packet {
  494:         seq_num = 5,
  495:         field_list = [#field {
  496:                         seq_num = 2,
  497:                         catalog = <<"def">>,
  498:                         db = <<>>,
  499:                         table = <<>>,
  500:                         org_table = <<>>,
  501:                         name = <<"HelloField">>,
  502:                         org_name = <<>>,
  503:                         type = 253,
  504:                         default = <<>>,
  505:                         charset_nr = 33,
  506:                         length = 15,
  507:                         flags = 1,
  508:                         decimals = 31 }],
  509:         rows = [],
  510:         extra = <<>>}.
  511: 
  512: get_single_test() ->
  513:     #result_packet {
  514:         seq_num = 5,
  515:         field_list = [#field {
  516:                         seq_num = 2,
  517:                         catalog = <<"def">>,
  518:                         db = <<>>,
  519:                         table = <<>>,
  520:                         org_table = <<>>,
  521:                         name = <<"HelloField">>,
  522:                         org_name = <<>>,
  523:                         type = 253,
  524:                         default = <<>>,
  525:                         charset_nr = 33,
  526:                         length = 15,
  527:                         flags = 1,
  528:                         decimals = 31 }],
  529:         rows = [[<<"Hello">>]],
  530:         extra = <<>>}.
  531: 
  532: get_multi_test() ->
  533:     #result_packet {
  534:         seq_num = 7,
  535:         field_list = [#field {
  536:                         seq_num = 2,
  537:                         catalog = <<"def">>,
  538:                         db = <<>>,
  539:                         table = <<>>,
  540:                         org_table = <<>>,
  541:                         name = <<"HelloField">>,
  542:                         org_name = <<>>,
  543:                         type = 253,
  544:                         default = <<>>,
  545:                         charset_nr = 33,
  546:                         length = 15,
  547:                         flags = 1,
  548:                         decimals = 31 },
  549:                       #field {
  550:                         seq_num = 3,
  551:                         catalog = <<"def">>,
  552:                         db = <<>>,
  553:                         table = <<>>,
  554:                         org_table = <<>>,
  555:                         name = <<"HiField">>,
  556:                         org_name = <<>>,
  557:                         type = 253,
  558:                         default = <<>>,
  559:                         charset_nr = 33,
  560:                         length = 6,
  561:                         flags = 1,
  562:                         decimals = 31 },
  563:                       #field {
  564:                         seq_num = 4,
  565:                         catalog = <<"def">>,
  566:                         db = <<>>,
  567:                         table = <<>>,
  568:                         org_table = <<>>,
  569:                         name = <<"ByeField">>,
  570:                         org_name = <<>>,
  571:                         type = 253,
  572:                         default = <<>>,
  573:                         charset_nr = 33,
  574:                         length = 9,
  575:                         flags = 1,
  576:                         decimals = 31 }],
  577:          rows = [[<<"Hello">>,<<"Hi">>,<<"Bye">>]],
  578:         extra = <<>>}.
